IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO INSPIRE MEANINGFUL CONNECTIONS BETWEEN PEOPLE AND NATURE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE SCHUYLKILL CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION INSPIRES MEANINGFUL CONNECTIONS BETWEEN PEOPLE AND NATURE. WE USE OUR FORESTS AND FIELDS AS A LIVING LABORATORY TO FOSTER APPRECIATION, DEEPEN UNDERSTANDING, AND ENCOURAGE STEWARDSHIP OF THE ENVIRONMENT.
IRS990.Desc: ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION - THE CENTER OFFERS A DIVERSE ARRAY OF PROGRAMS FOR PRESCHOOLS AND SCHOOLS, AS WELL AS THE GENERAL PUBLIC. SIGNATURE PROGRAMS INCLUDE NATURE PHL, FIELD TRIPS FOR STUDENTS IN PREK - 12 SCHOOLS, SUMMER CAMPS AND DAY OFF CAMPS, LARGE WEEKEND FESTIVALS, A YEAR-ROUND NATURE-BASED PRESCHOOL AND AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAM, AND A VARIETY OF WORKSHOPS AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR THE PUBLIC.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: LAND AND FACILITIES, INCLUDING LAND RESTORATION - THE LAND AND FACILITIES DEPARTMENT WORKS TO RESTORE THE FORESTS AND MEADOWS OF OUR 340-ACRE PROPERTY, ESPECIALLY IN PENN'S NATIVE ACRES, A 15-ACRE NATIVE PLANT PRESERVE. VOLUNTEERS AND SPECIAL EVENTS BRING THE COMMUNITY INTO OUR RESTORATION PROGRAMMING, REMOVING INVASIVE SPECIES, AND ADDRESSING STORM WATER CONCERNS, WHILE REPLANTING THE NATIVE SPECIES THAT PROVIDE A GREATER BENEFIT TO THE ECOSYSTEM.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ENVIRONMENTAL ART AND OTHER - THE ENVIRONMENTAL ART DEPARTMENT INCITES CURIOSITY AND SPARKS AWARENESS OF THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT THROUGH ART. THE DEPARTMENT WORKS COLLABORATIVELY TO CREATE INDOOR AND OUTDOOR EXHIBITIONS THAT ATTRACT, EDUCATE, AND INSPIRE THE PUBLIC.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: WILDLIFE CLINIC - THE WILDLIFE CLINIC, STAFFED BY STATE AND FEDERALLY LICENSED REHABILITATORS, CARES FOR SOME 4,000 INJURED, SICK, AND ORPHANED ANIMALS ANNUALLY, ALL BROUGHT BY THE COMMUNITY TO OUR FACILITY, AND STRIVES TO RELEASE THEM BACK INTO THEIR NATURAL HABITAT. MEDICAL TREATMENT AND TEMPORARY REFUGE ARE PROVIDED FOR NATIVE BIRDS, MAMMALS, REPTILES AND AMPHIBIANS IN NEED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DESCRIPTION OF COLLECTIONS THE CENTER'S COLLECTIONS CONSIST OF BOTH LIVING AND NON-LIVING COLLECTIONS, EACH SUPPORTING THE CENTER'S MISSION OF CREATING IMMERSIVE EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES. THE CENTER'S 340 ACRES OF PRIVATELY OWNED AND MANAGED PROPERTY IS THE LARGEST, NON-GOVERNMENT OWNED OPEN SPACE WITHIN THE CITY LIMITS OF PHILADELPHIA, PENNSYLVANIA AND IS ONE OF THE FIRST ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES LOCATED WITHIN THE LIMITS OF A MAJOR METROPOLITAN AREA. THE LIVING COLLECTIONS INCLUDE A "LAND COLLECTION" OF ECOSYSTEMS - WOODLANDS, MEADOWS, SUCCESSIONAL HARDWOOD FORESTS, WETLANDS, RIPARIAN CORRIDORS AND AQUATIC HABITATS; A NATIVE PLANT NURSERY; THE WILD ANIMALS, BIRDS AND INSECTS LIVING IN THESE HABITATS; NON-RELEASABLE DEMONSTRATION ANIMALS HOUSED AT THE WILDLIFE REHABILITATION CLINIC; A GREEN ROOF; AND MORE THAN 15 SPECIES OF DEMONSTRATION BUTTERFLIES. NON-LIVING COLLECTIONS INCLUDE A 1,400 INDIGENOUS SPECIES HERBARIUM; THOUSANDS OF PLANT, ANIMAL AND MINERAL SPECIMENS; REVOLVING EXHIBITS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ARTWORK; HUNDREDS OF PHOTOGRAPHS AND SLIDES, INCLUDING HISTORICAL PHOTOS OF THE CENTER'S GROUNDS AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITY; HISTORICAL STRUCTURAL REMNANTS THROUGHOUT THE CENTER'S PROPERTY; AND A DEMONSTRATION SOLAR PV INSTALLATION.
INTENDED USE OF ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS OF THE CENTER ARE TO BE USED PRIMARILY FOR THE OPERATIONS OF THE CENTER AND ITS MISSION.

UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER ASC 740 GAAP REQUIRES ENTITIES TO EVALUATE, MEASURE, RECOGNIZE AND DISCLOSE ANY UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN ON THEIR TAX RETURNS. GAAP PRESCRIBES A MINIMUM RECOGNITION THRESHOLD THAT A TAX POSITION IS REQUIRED TO MEET IN ORDER TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE CENTER BELIEVES IT HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS DEFINED IN GAAP.
LOSS ON RETURN OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS -79,578.
COST OF GOODS SOLD -35,288. DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES -14,504.
COST OF GOODS SOLD 35,288. DIRECT FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 14,504.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO GOVERNING DOCUMENTS THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE'S PROPOSED CHANGES TO THE CALENDAR, WOULD RESULT IN FOUR REGULAR BOARD MEETINGS PLUS THE ANNUAL MEETING IN JUNE, THEREBY REORIENTING THE BOARD YEAR CALENDAR TO MATCH THE FISCAL YEAR. DUE TO THIS PROPOSAL THE BYLAWS WERE UPDATED FOR THE CHANGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING BODY REVIEW OF FORM 990 THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, THE PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE FINANCE COMMITTEE BEFORE THE RETURN IS SIGNED. IN ADDITION, A FINAL COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO EACH MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO ITS FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MONITORING AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF EVERY BOARD TRUSTEE TO MONITOR COMPLIANCE. ANNUAL COMPLETION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY FORM IS REQUIRED. WHEN THERE IS A CONCERN THAT THERE MAY BE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST, TRUSTEES WILL SEEK GUIDANCE FROM THOSE TRUSTEES WHO ARE ATTORNEYS OR SEEK OUTSIDE LEGAL COUNSEL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES REVIEWS THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S PERFORMANCE AND INSTITUTES SALARY ADJUSTMENTS ANNUALLY THEREAFTER, DETERMINED BY PREVIOUS HISTORY AND BUDGETING. IN THE CASE OF THE CURRENT EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, A SEARCH FIRM CONTRACTED BY THE CENTER PROVIDED INPUT ON SALARY BASED ON COMPARABLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES' SALARIES ARE ADJUSTED VIA THE APPROVED ANNUAL BUDGET. ANY BUDGETED SALARY INCREASES ARE IMPLEMENTED BASED ON STAFF HIRE DATES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PUBLIC AVAILABILITY OF GOVERNING DOCUMENTS THE CENTER MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
LOSS ON RETURN OF CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS -79,578.
